website_summaries.verdict: This racket is designed for power, but some have questioned its long-term durability.
pros: Stop Shock pads improve comfort and reduce vibration
Strung with special power strings to generate more power on every stroke
Cool, comfortable grip keeps the racket from slipping from your hands
cons: Scattered reports of frame breaking after using the racket a few times

customer_reviews.title: Tennis Racket/Swatter
customer_reviews.text: This is the bee and wasp destroyer at our house! Everyday we have bees and wasp fly over our privacy fence, I am allergic to their venom. Now the pests go for a fast flight. It is a nice tennis racket too.
customer_reviews.author: What's up with that?

customer_reviews.title: Hammer Power!
customer_reviews.text: Great racquet, awesome power! I went from 3-6, 2-6 to 6-0, 6-0 against my 5 year old niece. Now who's the cry baby??
customer_reviews.author: Archer

customer_reviews.title: Great starter racquet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to get back into tennis, and here I am almost a year later using the same thing. I've played over 50 individual sessions (1+ hours per) with this one. The grip/strings are still holding up. I didn't know if I was going to take to tennis again, but I did. My next racquet will probably be $100+ for the amount that I enjoy the sport. If you're testing the waters like I was, then this is for you. Not the best obviously, but does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Wulfe

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT CHOICE FOR BEGINNER THROUGH INTERMEDIATE
customer_reviews.text: MY WIFE AND I JUST UPGRADED FROM 10 YEAR OLD PRINCE RACKETS TO THIS WILSON. MY GRIP IS 4 3/8 AND HER'S IS 4 1/4. WE ARE JUST PLAYING FOR FUN AND EXERCISE. WE ARE NOT RANKED, AND WE ONLY PLAY OUTSIDE DURING FAVORABLE WEATHER. THESE RACKETS ARE LIGHT, STRONG, RESPONSIVE AND FORGIVING. BOTH OF OUR GAMES HAVE IMPROVED WITH THIS WILSON. VERY SATISFIED. I WOULD SAY THIS IS A GOOD CHOICE FOR BEGINNER THROUGH INTERMEDIATE.
customer_reviews.author: Angelo Lattuca

customer_reviews.title: Good For Learning Tennis
customer_reviews.text: This is a low cost, light weight tennis racket for beginners. I used it to learn tennis. It wasn't too expensive. However it would have been less expensive to buy a racket on sale at a department or sporting goods store. Although I did need the racket quickly: thank you Amazon Prime.
customer_reviews.author: JP KazarianTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works very well for my teenage daughter who is brand new to the sport. I used the second one to play with her and had a blast. Warning, if you try this with your son/daughter, prepare to have a few days of soreness afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: Chris "Great day for hay"

customer_reviews.title: Warped after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to my son in August for his birthday so he’d be ready for tennis in the spring. He used it a few times before it got cold and loved it. We got him a new bag for Christmas and when he pulled this out to put it in the new bag, it had warped! Of course the return window was only a month. Money wasted. Lesson learned. Choose a different racquet.
customer_reviews.author: James Cody Case

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner racket
customer_reviews.text: I bought this racket for my 14 year old daughter. She was using a junior sized racket previously. This is a good racket at a good price. I did not want to get her a really expensive racket, since she is very new to tennis. This fits the bill perfectly. It provides a large sweet spot and a good amount of power, which she needs. If she keeps playing tennis, I think that she should be able to use this for a couple of years before she may want to buy another one. I recommend this racket for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: What a wonderful racket
customer_reviews.text: I had playing with the same racket for the past 7-8 years, and this time when the string broke, I decided to get a new one. I have now played twice with the Wilson Hyper Hammer, and what a difference; the racket is so forgiving that my off-center shots still have decent speed, and I am making fewer mistakes at the net. It is both lighter and bigger than my old Prince racket. Wish I had switched to this years ago !
customer_reviews.author: Barun Chandra

customer_reviews.title: No matter how hard I hit it, the ball hung in the air.
customer_reviews.text: Because I couldn't find my custom racquet - not used in 10 years, I decided that this racquet would do just fine. Hitting with new balls, I could not get any power no matter how hard and accurately I hit. It is like there was a regulator on that Happily, my custom racquet was found and I began playing with it. No trouble slamming the ball. Should have returned.
customer_reviews.author: krasi

customer_reviews.title: This racket is great for having for a friend who plays tennis every ...
customer_reviews.text: This racket is great for having for a friend who plays tennis every now and then. Very solid cheap racket. Don't expect amazing game improvements from this but it's very good for someone looking to just get outside and hit some balls
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The racket is sturdy, the strings are fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this racket to replace my old one that I've been playing with for a year now. As always, Wilson is a reliable brand for all of their Tennis Gear. The racket is sturdy, the strings are fantastic. The reason I've taken one star off of the racket is because after 3 - 4 sets of playing with it, the grip has started to shift and it already needs to be replaced. It's not an arduous task, but grips usually last longer than this. In the end, I'd still recommend this to any players who play as a hobby and need a solid racket that's inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Larry H.

customer_reviews.title: For a beginner a bit heavy and I had forearm fatigue
customer_reviews.text: At this price, you can't really go wrong. But I would warn the beginner that this racket is a bit on the heavier side. Especially, as a beginner you are trying to practice and hit as many balls as possible. I got some serious arm fatigue --- granted I may just be old, and old and out of shape. Nonetheless, I elected to buy a new graphite racket and my experience improved significantly. I guess the old adage that you get what you pay for is true.
customer_reviews.author: My Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great racket. Feels nice and light. With skills like mine you don't need any better.
customer_reviews.author: Dmitriy Aristov

customer_reviews.title: Makes easy to get back to Tennis
customer_reviews.text: Started Tennis after good 15 years. This racket is little head heavy and that adds power to shots. I tried Head Si6 before buying this and finally settled on Wilson Hyper Hammer 5.3. This is a very forgiving racket (Due to size) and perfect for recreational play/matches.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a great racket for the price--very light but supplies power with ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great racket for the price--very light but supplies power with the oversized top-heavy. Control doesn't suffer too much as a result--good in-between racket for those mid-level players looking for balance between power and control.
customer_reviews.author: J. Woznicki

customer_reviews.title: Good Overall, But Buy New Grip And String
customer_reviews.text: I am just an amateur who mostly plays against the wall and not a person. I have gone through several rackets in my life with Babolat and Wilson being my favorite manufacturers. I usually look for a racket with comfort, control, and durability. This racket appears to have great durability. Small issue with the comfort, the grip tape did not last long for me; the original tape was moving all over the place after three sessions. Not much control, but new string will fix that. All in all this is a good "beginner" or amateur racket. It is not perfect out of the box, but for the price it will keep me happy for easily a year.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my wife, who has never played before. She likes the color. I liked the price. She has already gotten pretty good with it in just a few weeks, and it seems to have good balance and control for a beginner racket. I will update if she breaks it within a year or two. If it lasts beyond that, then I consider it a good value. If you are looking for something that will definitely last or if you are not a beginner, I would suggest spending more on a higher quality racket. I have no complaints with this one though.
customer_reviews.author: mfrazier

customer_reviews.title: Great racket
customer_reviews.text: The racket is really good. I play a couple times a week and it has lifted my game. The larger head is great for beginners and intermediates. If you're looking for a racket but not trying to break the bank I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too Much Vibration. Avoid If possible
customer_reviews.text: Considering the price it does a reasonable job. But still, I expected it to be more sturdy. I have used this almost 2 months now, and after a couple of weeks, the wires started to get distorted. Initially, I thought its because my shots are not correct. But after changing to another racquet, I found out it’s actually the issue of the racquet which is not tightly wired. Also, the vibration in the racquet is more and sometimes uncomfortable to play with. So if you are a super beginner, you might want to try this. But if you want to have a good experience in the game, you should avoid this.
customer_reviews.author: Sanjib Kumar Baral

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Tried this Wilson racquet and was not impressed, based on description for 4.0 players this was the Racquet to buy, the description is wrong this is for beginner players 2.5-3.0. I couldn’t get control on a lot of shots and trying to utilize a short ball at the net was extremely hard. I decided to switch back to my usual racquet a Prince and had better outcome.i think the Wilson Blade would be the better option for stronger players. This was returned. Ps gave it 3 starts only cause of price.
customer_reviews.author: Jason L.

customer_reviews.title: great racket for the price
customer_reviews.text: i was using an old racket until i started using this one.... huge difference..... yippee!! ------------- update : so i ended buying the Wilson Ultra Team Tennis Racket from costco because it was on sale... and i figured i want to see the difference with a more expensive racket ($109 on amazon but $49 at costco).... it sucked... it felt weird... it didn't hit the ball as well as this racket.... i ended up returning it.... this one i just had to replace the grip... that made a huge difference :)
customer_reviews.author: Ricco Talavera

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Amazing racket. My fiancé and I (he has the green version of this racket) received these for Christmas and haven't been able to stop playing tennis together. They work great for us. They are light weight and really attractive looking. The only flaw is the grip is white so it gets dirty really quick!
customer_reviews.author: WO

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner racket
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a backup racket for when I have a beginner friend playing with me. The large surface area is helpful for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan Hanrahan

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these - one for me and one for my fiancee. Neither of us are really tennis players, but there are courts near our house and we thought it would be a good way to get some exercise. Man, tennis is HARD. Especially when you have no real idea what you are doing. That said, these racquets were well-built and had just the right amount of heft for our skill level. The seem like they would last for decades. I am glad I chose these, and think most anyone who wants to try out the sport could do FAR worse than giving these a go. Hope this info helps.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Reed

customer_reviews.title: Great value for weekend warrior
customer_reviews.text: Great racket for price. I use to play regularly 10 years ago. This is much better than my old rackets...at a fraction of the cost. I also bought a middle of the road Head...Conquest Ti. This Wilson is clearly the better overall racket of the 3. I plan to buy another for my teen
customer_reviews.author: Jeff in So Cal

customer_reviews.title: For the beginner
customer_reviews.text: This is a great racket for the very beginning of your journey. If you start and play once or twice a week for a decent amount of time, this racket is perfect for that first season. If you're adept, you'll grow out of it quick. Don't spend more though, until you know your style, grip size etc. Get his one and then you'll have an idea what you need to step up to.
customer_reviews.author: Don Jr

customer_reviews.title: For a very beginner
customer_reviews.text: Fine racket. Looked good, even though it was second hand still looked new. Definitely a very beginner racket... basic but would be good for a kid starting out. Probably wouldn’t re but. I bought it as a back up racket for my husband... I don’t think he will use it even as that. He is a tennis couch. Might give it away to a student.
customer_reviews.author: Brian King

customer_reviews.title: Reliable racquet that is okay.
customer_reviews.text: It is an affordable racquet, but it isn't the best that I've had in the under $100 range. I've had other Wilson racquets that I purchased for between $70-100 that were better than this. Knowing what I know now, I'm not sure I would get this racquet. I use this as my backup or for my friends if they didn't bring their racquet or if their strings snapped.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my house guests so they can play tennis at a local court and it is a very nice racket at the price point. The experienced tennis player will want their gut stringed carbon fiber racket - and this isn't that. This is a good, inexpensive racket for recreational use that will do 95% of what you will ever need. Perfect for the adult beginner.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Barton

customer_reviews.title: Great Racket for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this racket to replace a racket that I was having issues with. This racket is great! I was able to hit with more power and control. I also was able to get top spin, something that I was having difficulty doing with my old racket. The only thing to be aware of is that this racket does not come with a bag/sleeve. That was fine for me, because I already have a bag.
customer_reviews.author: L. Seifert

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners but has some quirks
customer_reviews.text: I played with this for a few months until I broke down and bought a way nicer racket. This one is great for testing the waters...you can drop it and not be too worried about it. But, I think the tension of the strings is off because even when you hit the ball in the "sweet spot" you still get a "clong" sound instead of a "pock" sound that you want to hear. The weight is relatively decently distributed but after 30-45 minutes, I would get arm fatigue. Don't plan on becoming a pro with this one...it's good for just getting to know the game.
customer_reviews.author: J Stone

customer_reviews.title: it's perfect.
customer_reviews.text: It is what it is, a cheap beginner tennis racket. If that's what you are looking for, it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great choice for the beginner
customer_reviews.text: This racquet is light and feels great. The ideal equipment for starter and intermediated player. Great choice for the beginner.
customer_reviews.author: el papa

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING I WON THE DAVIS CUP!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing, terrific, gorgeous, incredible! Thanks to this racket I dominate the Davis cup. There was no story for the others. Impressive tool, as powerful as a 50mm, as light as a baby wind. Love it
customer_reviews.author: valerio

customer_reviews.title: perfect size and weight
customer_reviews.text: This racket is so comfortable to use. It has made me able to return stronger shots and pick up many others that I couldn't get before. The pro at my club also commented at what a great racket it was.
customer_reviews.author: Long time Customer Barb

customer_reviews.title: It hits tennis balls....
customer_reviews.text: Works well for this amateur, certainly not held back by the racquet. Solid one piece construction. Handle tape is starting to come loose after 3 uses, will see when that needs repair.
customer_reviews.author: S.

customer_reviews.title: Best buy
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a present for my boyfriend who is beginner trying to improve to intermediate. After looking at dozens of reviews and not wanting to spend more than 100$ on something that I wasn't sure would actually improve the game I decided on this one. And it was a bingo. He is extremely satisfied with head size and light weight and enjoys playing even more than with his last one (some random racquet). Also looks nice :) All in all, I think it doesn't get much better than this one for begginer/intermediate level.
customer_reviews.author: Lana

customer_reviews.title: Was broken on 3-rd day, I hit by mistake ...
customer_reviews.text: Was broken on 3-rd day, I hit by mistake the ball by the rim, and the rim was broken, Want to mention that never hit the racquet to floor or any other solid thing, only the ball Each normal racquet should never been broken by the ball, max could be damaged the cords
customer_reviews.author: Mamikon

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners - doesn’t include a cover
customer_reviews.text: Bought this racket for my wife who is just learning the game. We were disappointed it didn’t come with a cover but for the money it’s still a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for beginners. We just wanted something to play around with to make use of our neighborhood tennis courts. Probably not ideal for pros.
customer_reviews.author: ARJ

customer_reviews.title: Very Light
customer_reviews.text: Extremely light and easy to grip. I like it better than my $100 Babolat racket.
customer_reviews.author: papaya38

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: This racket was a great deal. Would recommend, especially for only around $20. I have a similar racket that I purchased about 10 years ago, and it's still working great. I bought this as a second racket for my partner.
customer_reviews.author: eee

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with the strings snapped and broken do not buy!
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: If You Buy This, Get Grip Tape
customer_reviews.text: I am just beginning tennis lessons and didn't want to invest in an expensive racquet in case I didn't like tennis. Unfortunately this racquet is so cheaply made that it interfered with my playing. The racquet slips in the hand because the material is very smooth. I had to order grip tape to get it to work. If I had to do it again, I'd just spend a few more dollars for a better racquet. Still it's not an entirely bad racquet and I'm not unhappy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Collette

customer_reviews.title: Good for beginner, light to handle
customer_reviews.text: It is light and easy to handle in hand, easy to move around, but the handler is a bit wide, letting me not easy to turn it around at an angle when I am hitting ball. It is helpful for beginner to learn what's the comfortable point to hit the ball, but it is not so good the hit the ball very strongly, because it is a little lighter that make it not easy to keep an angle when it rebounds the ball. Though it is light to move around your body, you should learn to use your body to control the strongness and direction to hit the ball.
customer_reviews.author: Raynchow

customer_reviews.title: Best racket purchased! Well balanced
customer_reviews.text: This racket is super well weight balance. It is a very very good racket for this price. I would highly recommend this to anyone who is looking to start tennis. My bestfriend is tennis mom and she came to the house and looked at it and she loves them very very much and she says it’s really really good
customer_reviews.author: karen

customer_reviews.title: Started crushing my brother after switching to this racquet!
customer_reviews.text: Great racquet for beginner play or just leisure play in general. Great quality for price. I play just for fun with my brother every now and then (we are both subpar tennis players) and I have started crushing him after switching to this racquet! Least common denominator... this racquet! I would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Justin N

customer_reviews.title: A great racket for my son but this thing plenty of power and spin
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son, I tried it myself with some limited references. The racket have plenty of power, I have a Wilson profile si 2.7 newly strung at 58lb, this one could generate almost same power but with lots more spin. Played with some bodies, they have a babolat boost D and this racket have better control and spin.
customer_reviews.author: B. Yu

customer_reviews.title: Great budget racquet..
customer_reviews.text: Recently replaced an intermediate racquet for this one with a larger head. I'm a beginner and had no idea initially that larger heads are recommended for new people to the sport. The racquet is well made and sturdy while offering excellent impact absorption. Not too heavy and easy to handle. Strings are nice and not too hard compared to the other ihead I purchased. Would have given 5 stars but the handle appears to be deteriorating after only a few practice sessions. Otherwise, a great value and my game has improved immensely...
customer_reviews.author: bman

customer_reviews.title: This racket is lightweight and has really good handle
customer_reviews.text: I brought this one compare to my 30 dollar racket I can tell the difference between the racket handle it is got really good grid on the handle and the material is lightweight. I picked up tennis during the pandemic and it is been a really good spots to do. Also wilson is a very good brand as well I got my golf clubs from them too.
customer_reviews.author: Cherry

customer_reviews.title: Very nice racket
customer_reviews.text: Great value for money, perfect racket for beginner or intermediate players.
customer_reviews.author: Viswanath S Chirravuri

customer_reviews.title: Default Racket strings tension is not good enough
customer_reviews.text: Racket quality is good but strings tension is not good enough for intermediate or advanced players. Strings are getting separated on playing few shots on day 1 of purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Viswanath S Chirravuri

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Good price. My son (12) likes it for his beginners tennis practice.
customer_reviews.author: Endodoc

customer_reviews.title: Great racket
customer_reviews.text: Im a beginner in tennis and bought this racket base on reviews I saw and it hasn't dissapointed me at all. This racket feels great and its very light compare to other racket I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: juan pinto

customer_reviews.title: Daughter loves it, super light!
customer_reviews.text: This is my daughters second season of tennis and she plum wore out her first racquet. This one was super light. She loved the look and style of it. She improved so much this year due to hard work and new equipment. I would recommend this to any player new to advanced.
customer_reviews.author: Jennny C

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Got this racket for 85$ I started out with those 20-30$ beginner rackets you get at Walmart. Soon realized that my shots weren’t generating enough power and it was difficult playing against people who hit the ball hard. After using this racket for 2 weeks, I must say this racket lives up to its name. Light and strong, my shots have more power and accuracy. Also, returning balls is easier since it absorbs the pressure pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: Apoorv

customer_reviews.title: Super thrilled with this racket
customer_reviews.text: I'm returning to tennis as an older adult so I wanted to find a racket that has a larger head, comfortable grip, lightweight, and a good size sweet spot. This fits the bill perfectly. I played today and even though I'm rusty at tennis, I was able to consistently rally the ball with this very light racket.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Colt

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice!
customer_reviews.text: I am a beginner tennis player and have really enjoyed this racket! My instructor said that the light the racket, the better. I feel like this is a good learning racket and I've really enjoyed playing so far! :-)
customer_reviews.author: RickiJoH

customer_reviews.title: Great racket for the price and it's a good deal
customer_reviews.text: Some of the reviews and honestly when I received my racket I was surprised with that some of the people's complaints I don't know what they were expecting for a racket that cost $22 but I was pleasantly surprised it's a nice racket it's a little late for me I'm pretty strong player so but all in all this is a Dependable racket it's nice to hit the mall whether you want to play competitively or not great
customer_reviews.author: CECELIA

customer_reviews.title: Good Basic Racket
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my house guests so they can play tennis at a local court and it is a very nice racket at the price point. The experienced tennis player will want their gut stringed carbon fiber racket - and this isn't that. This is a good, inexpensive racket for recreational use that will do 95% of what you will ever need. Perfect for the adult beginner.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Barton

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Started playing tennis during COVID-19, was using some old racket we had around the house, developed wrist pain. Got this racket, measured correctly (I'm a 5'7" female, 4 1⁄4 grip size) my game improved and my wrist pain disappeared. And let me tell you, this racket has POWER.
customer_reviews.author: Adrianna

customer_reviews.title: I am now a tennis pro
customer_reviews.text: Other than a white grip getting dirtier and grimier more quickly than any other would, this tennis racket has propelled me up the ranks toward world domination. I am a tennis pro. At the bubble. I play like McEnroe. Strong backhand. Rhymes with sweatband. Blue is also the more beautiful! Enjoy very much like me, I hope.
customer_reviews.author: architect_review_companion

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter wrists were broken last spring. She was using my racket, a Wilson Grandslam superlight. This is an excellent racket, but was too heavy for her healing wrists. I ordered tgis one hoping it would be light enough for her and it was! Still had great strength but was super light. She loves it!
customer_reviews.author: trisha

customer_reviews.title: Came in with the grip tape peeling off
customer_reviews.text: I received it with the tape already peeling off. The first game I tried playing it the grip tape completely came apart.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Holds up - no speed
customer_reviews.text: No speed but excellent well balanced racket. Impossible to play at high speeds due to weight but ignoring that fantastic racket.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan

customer_reviews.title: Nice Intro Racket
customer_reviews.text: Haven't played in forty years and this racket is very affordable to get into the swing of things.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: OK for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I got it since it was one of the cheapest ones. I generally am happy with it, however, it is not 100% straight shape and that bugs me. Otherwise, it's light enough and I had a lot of fun with it.
customer_reviews.author: Vlad

customer_reviews.title: Great value, durable
customer_reviews.text: Actually bought this to hit baseballs/fly balls accurately to my two boys... if it can handle the baseballs, which it has, then tennis balls have no chance
customer_reviews.author: Ibburnk18cnu

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a novice
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know anything about tennis. My son did tennis for a few years and was in need of a new rack. This did the trick for him.
customer_reviews.author: Destiny W

customer_reviews.title: Great racket for a beginner.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the look and feel of this racket. I am enjoying the use I get out of it. Great for a beginner.
customer_reviews.author: Lance Laube

customer_reviews.title: Solid racquet for getting started
customer_reviews.text: I used to play raquetball quiet a bit, but now have picked up tennis in the summer with a group of guys from the neighborhood. This is a nice racquet, light and well strung. The grip is great and doesn't slip even when all sweaty. It will be a while before I outgrow it, if ever.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner rackets for adults
customer_reviews.text: Me and my boyfriend are in college and we wanted to pick up tennis. We both got one of these rackets and we love them. They are sturdy, lightweight and have been perfect for us beginners! Love them so far. We have played around 30 times with them and they are doing great. We were worried they might be too small because of the reviews stating this but they are both normal sized rackets. I'm sure they would be good for both adults and older children. I added a size comparison to the pictures.
customer_reviews.author: E Fox

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: My son started playing tennis for his middle school team- this racket is perfect for him as it’s inexpensive and lightweight. The grip is comfortable. He’s been playing with it for a few weeks now and it seems pretty durable. Wilson is a good brand so I expect this to last a while.
customer_reviews.author: Shawna MikiTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Beginner Racket
customer_reviews.text: I bought this racket about 6 months ago. I wanted something cheap but reliable to get into the sport. I’ve been playing almost every other day and it still feels the same when I got it. Even the grip has stayed in great condition. I definitely recommend this for someone who wants to play tennis, but doesn’t know where to start.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas LaPorte

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Love this one! I played with the older model for 20 years and this one is just as amazing. Good for smaller women who need more power in their stroke. Good control and large sweet spot.
customer_reviews.author: Devaney S Pitre

customer_reviews.title: very disapointed
customer_reviews.text: very disapointed, never more. I expected nice functional item but received a damaged one :-(
customer_reviews.author: Petra

customer_reviews.title: Very Amature review here
customer_reviews.text: So far this thing has held up very well. I could not believe the incredibly low price for a Racquet. I have used it about 15 times for about and hour each time. I am still learning. Like many others I do like to hit the tennis ball pretty hard some times. Mostly when my wife starts to get ahead in points. This thing gets the ball moving and I have no issues with pain in my wrists or any kind of shock feeling when playing with it.
customer_reviews.author: LP

customer_reviews.title: Nice balance
customer_reviews.text: A big improvement over the cheap aluminum racquet I was using previously. It's slightly lighter, but the balance shift makes it possible for me (a not so good player) to return hard serves.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander R. Pruss

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Love the grip; the light weight helps with control at the net. The extra length gives this power. The short grip is great too. This is a tough racket. It’s not as heavy as some, but the face of the racket is long, so you get an advantage there.
customer_reviews.author: deglispiriti

customer_reviews.title: Sweet
customer_reviews.text: I have used this racket for years. Hope Wilson continues to manufacture it. I play doubles and I like the control and weight, I get kidded about the size, but I laughed my way to three USTA national championships using it.
customer_reviews.author: BRIAN R COOPER

customer_reviews.title: Top racket for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Good for beginner, intermediate and has ample power and forgiveness. This racket is quite light as well. I brought a second one for the household players. I don’t think you will go wrong with this one.
customer_reviews.author: K. Kar

customer_reviews.title: The strings were loose, maybe old rackets
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if i got the bad egg here but the rackets i got seem to have loose strings, after every shot I can see that the strings contract and they don't return tot he original position and need to be set manually after almost every swing.
customer_reviews.author: Torpedo

customer_reviews.title: Racket broke on hitting the ball
customer_reviews.text: I have used this racket for 6 months, it is lightweight but I never thought it would break on hitting the tennis ball.
customer_reviews.author: gkso

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend especially for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I notice that a lot of people have been giving good reviews on this racquet but I believe this is terrible racquet especially for beginners. Because of its heavy weight, it makes it very easy for a beginner to develop very bad habit or cause long term injury. Try to save up more money and get a better and lighter racquet.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Choi

customer_reviews.title: Too heavy. Ok for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Great for beginners as the head is huge letting you hit most points. However, it is way too heavy compared to more expensive models and after a long game I can feel my hands.
customer_reviews.author: djairo

customer_reviews.title: Good racket.
customer_reviews.text: It is a good racket. There is nothing special about it. It should do well for a beginner. Nothing really good or bad to say about it.
customer_reviews.author: David Le

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Tennis Racket
customer_reviews.text: We needed a basic tennis racket for when someone invites us to play. This fits the bill perfectly. Its easy to use and very reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth P

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I never really was a tennis player but just started as a fun form of exercise. This racquet works great for me. I just gotta learn how to control the ball so that the ball doesn’t fly off in different direction every few hits
customer_reviews.author: Julia Oduro

customer_reviews.title: Im just starting to play tennis and was recommended to get this racket
customer_reviews.text: OMG! Im just starting to play tennis and was recommended to get this racket. It feels fantastic to play with it. I feel like a pro!
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Peralta

customer_reviews.title: great value
customer_reviews.text: My son is practicing tennis a long time ago, but he is growing and have to change the racket every 2 years, we always buy fir him 2 rackets for his training but now he is 10 and we should try to buy a more professional racket for him
customer_reviews.author: Davie Siu

customer_reviews.title: Very nice racket for the $
customer_reviews.text: I used to play a lot, but now just hit around with my wife, we got two of these and they are great. Light, comfortable and inexpensive. The built in damping for the strings actually works well too.
customer_reviews.author: barley1999

customer_reviews.title: Great for Beginners
customer_reviews.text: I am a beginner taking my first tennis clinic, and this racket has certainly met my needs - lightweight and a large hitting surface. Now, if I could just hit the ball back over the net! Haha!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too Much Vibration
customer_reviews.text: I have a 40+ year old graphite Wilson Sting racket that is a tag heavier but no vibration and a significant sweet spot. So, getting this one I was expecting a significant improvement. Nope, lighter but tons of vibration. It just feels cheap to me. I went back to the Wilson Sting.
customer_reviews.author: Camera Shy

customer_reviews.title: Super light, comfortable grip.
customer_reviews.text: These are so light I didn’t think they came in the box! I am having so much fun learning tennis(and hitting the ball for my dog) with these rackets!
customer_reviews.author: Kirstyn Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: A perfect racquet for beginners
customer_reviews.text: I just started playing tennis with my friend who's a pro instructing me. This purchase has been a great choice because the racquet is everything I was expecting - apt weight, quality, and price for a beginner level. Go for it guys!
customer_reviews.author: Mukul

customer_reviews.title: Great for every once in awhile
customer_reviews.text: Bought two for my husband and I to play at our apartment courts every now and then and they are great for that. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Caitie

customer_reviews.title: Good Racket for Casual Players
customer_reviews.text: I've been playing tennis for 20 years and this is the last racket I'll purchase. This is my third one. Sturdy, strings have long life and the racket is easy to re-string. Lightweight and powerful.
customer_reviews.author: John Kettering

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for beginners
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I are learning to play tennis and these are perfect for us as beginners. They are light and bright and we haven't had any issues after several months of use. Would recommend for adults based on the size - we're both 5'10" and they feel a little long.
customer_reviews.author: DVD

customer_reviews.title: not happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: we have bought cheaper rackets that lasted for years. this was most l have ever paid for a tennis racket and l have had it restrung twice already
customer_reviews.author: vimzy

product_meta.title: Wilson Federer Tennis Racquet (EA)
product_meta.description: Wilson, the iconic American tennis brand, was built by people with a deep devotion to the game. It was built on a promise: to elevate the millions of athletes around the world, at every level of the sport, who call Wilson their own. We've been keeping that promise for decades and our legacy is legend. Today, we're still building, relentlessly pushing the limits of performance and design to equip a new generation of players with products worthily of our name. Respect the past. Own the future. Wilson is tennis.
feature_bullets: Volcanic frame technology for power and stability
Stop shock pads for improved comfort
Strung, no cover. Unstrung balance:33.5cm/3 pts hl
Power strings longer main strings for explosive power

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
